entry.title: Allow sources to customize trigger data values and cardinality
entry.content:
https://github.com/WICG/attribution-reporting-api/pull/1129



This enables parsing and use of two new source-registration fields:

trigger_data and trigger_data_matching.



We use the existing TriggerSpecs type for parsing and Mojo

serialization, but return an internal error from storage if there are

multiple specs, since persistence and business logic for such a

configuration are not yet supported. (That is part of Full Flex.)



We move the existing Full Flex parsing code to a test-only method to

make it clear that it is not ready for general use; this allows us to

remove the "trigger config" feature that otherwise protected that code.



We avoid having to populate the new trigger_data proto field for

existing sources by treating absence of the field as equivalent to

specifying the default trigger-data cardinality for the source's source

type. We nonetheless bump the DB version to ensure that browser

downgrades do not result in this new field being ignored for sources

that *do* use non-default trigger data, because we raze the DB if the

version is too new.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Conversions.SourceRegistrationError10]=Replaced by Conversions.SourceRegistrationError11

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[CorruptReportsInDatabase4]=Replaced by CorruptReportsInDatabase5



Bug: 1497993

Change-Id: Ib2ac2d88498c7b90494087d462db104738400a9e

entry.title: [soft navigations] Refactor SoftNavigationEventScope creation
entry.content:
(1) Make SoftNavigationEventScope STACK_ALLOCATED:



SoftNavigationEventScope is currently heap allocated (not Oilpan) with

lifetime tied to a unique_ptr, which allows the scope to be null if

certain conditions aren't met, e.g. the feature is disabled. But all

scopes are actually tied to the lifetime of a function, and furthermore

the scopes should not span multiple tasks (should not be async). We

can get the same behavior using std::optional and making the scopes

STACK_ALLOCATED, which makes the lifetime clearer and predictable.



(2) Make SoftNavigationEventScope closer in line with TaskScope:

- Make it an inner class of SoftNavigationHeuristics (::EventScope)

- Make the constructor private and create via

SoftNavigationHeuristics::CreateEventScope(). In a follow-up CL,

cleaning up nested EventScopes, I'll move some of the complexity to

SoftNavigationHeuristics, which will help focus and shrink the

public API.



While a minor improvement in and of itself, this is also a small step

in unblocking refactoring multiple TaskAttributionTracker::Observers,

which is needed for crbug.com/40942324 (simplifying the task attribution

task graph).



Bug: 324111878

Change-Id: Ifb5ee3c3ba978f8d664face904307fdce8116a68

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5241861

Reviewed-by: Nate Chapin

Reviewed-by: Michal Mocny

Commit-Queue: Scott Haseley

Reviewed-by: Ian Clelland

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1260845}

entry.title: media: Generate report when Cdm reads file > 40KB
entry.content:
Use DumpWithoutCrashing to generate a report when a file that is over

40 KB is read by the CDM. The origin is already reported for all crashes

so all that is needed to be done is to "fake crash" when > 40 KB.



Tested it by changing the if condition to if(file_size_bytes > 0), and

used the Integration Console to generate a crash.



I then locally viewed the crash report using

```

.\strings64.exe .\c2178a18-c44d-432b-9ca3-94e8cdb6c69b.dmp | grep -C2 excessive

```



and saw



```

cdm-origin

https://integration.staging.widevine.com

```



Bug: b/310029102, 325331239

entry.title: [Android TRM] Integrate with Magic Stack.
entry.content:
This CL changes the Tab Resumption Module from an NTP-only standalone

module to a module within the Magic Stack, though shown on the NTP

only.



Known issues to be addressed in future work on the Magic Stack:

* The refresh button on the NTP no longer refreshes the TRM. Re-enabling

this will require updating Magic Stack to handle refreshes.

* With Magic Stack shown, disabling "Sync everything" hides the TRM

(as required), but re-enabling "Sync everything" does not bring

the TRM back immediately.



New feature: Long-click on the TRM shows context menu with

{"Hide tabs from other devices" , "Customize"} items to control feature

visibility.



Details:

* Remove standalone TRM from the NTP:

* NewTabPageLayout: Remove all use, including SuggestionClickCallback

taken from CTOR.

* Utils: Remove mayCreateTabResumptionModuleCoordinator().

* Integrate into Magic Stack:

* Update TabResumptionModuleView layout to include margins.

* HomeModulesCoordinator: Change getModuleList() to initialize general

module list item-by-item, to simplify logic. Also include TRM in

Start Surface.

* Add TabResumptionModuleBuilder implementing ModuleProviderBuilder:

* Takes over Coordinator and View creation.

* Performs explicit bind().

* isEligible(): Replaces shouldShowTabResumptionModule() from Util.

* Coordinator:

* Implement ModuleProvider.

* Decouple from View and PropertyModelChangeProcessor

* Take ModuleDelegate in CTOR and use it for URL click.

* Mediator:

* Add helpers for Coordinator use.

* Takes ModuleDelegate. On suggestions load, remove the TRM if data

unavailable (no un-hide since API is not yet present); call

onDataReady().

* ViewBinder: Decouple from ViewBinder and change bind() to static, to

follow Magic Stack requirements.

* TileViewer: Add explicit long-click handler that just returns false.

This is needed to prevent tiles (which handle click) from blocking

long-click context menu.

* Tests:

* Mediator: Minor update to pass ModuleProvider; most work were done

in crrev.com/c/5281359.

When a test has both a `[ Failure ]` TestExpectation and a baseline

harness error, the former should override the latter and expect OK to

avoid triggering retries and shard failure [0].

entry.title: Add a skeleton of the UTR tool at //tools/utr/
entry.content:
This tool will be used to repro compile and test failures seen on

bots. It'll be driven mostly by a custom recipe that wraps the main

chromium recipe that ~all browser bots runs.



This initial commit simply:

- creates the dir, and adds a README and a relevant OWNERS

- creates a run.py that will serve as the entry point into the tool

- defines a basic set of cmd-line args in run.py that should encompass

its basic usage (note though that it's not comprehensive, and we'll

likely add more args as it's developed)

- adds functionality to fetch + update the recipe bundle at run-time;

the bundle will be placed at //tools/utr/.bundle/



Bug: 41492688

entry.title: infra: Also add src-internal's notifiers handling to builders.star
entry.content:
https://crrev.com/c/5282543 was the first attempt at migrating

all infra/config/lib/ builder-related features in src-internal to

src. Some notification behavior that was needed in src-internal wasn't

copied over by accident. So this copies it over.



This behavior is (uniquely?) needed by src-internal since there are

some internal builder groups that have a module-level default with

some notifiers. But then some builders in that group explicitly

entry.title: [FspCache] Add a permanent watcher on root
entry.content:
The CloudFileSystem should add a recursive watcher on root whenever

there's a ContentCache. This means that the Cloud file system provider

will send notifications whenever there have been changes on the Cloud.

All notifications go through CloudFileSystem::Notify().



This is important so that the CloudFileSystem can know whether its

ContentCache is out of date.



Bug: b/317137739

entry.title: media/gpu/ip_factory: Add output storage type parameters
entry.content:
When called, ImageProcessorFactory::CreateWithInputCandidates(), sets

the ImageProcessor input and output frame storage type based on some

assumptions about how the VideoDecoderPipeline works.



For example, when an ImageProcessor is needed to convert images from

MM21 to NV12 on Mediatek devices, the input storage type is set to

STORAGE_DMABUFS to align with the StorageType used when the V4L2Queue

constructs a frame from a V4L2 buffer. For converters, the output

storage type is set to STORAGE_GPU_MEMORY_BUFFER to align with the

VideoDecoderPipeline frame pool.



The image processor tests and perf tests align with this policy and

tests pass correctly today. This CL chain changes the frame pool

output type from STORAGE_GPU_MEMORY_BUFFER to STORAGE_DMABUFS. However

this happens over a series of commits.



To accommodate these changes, a parameter is being added to

CreateWithInputCandidates() for the output frame storage type. The

*ForTesting() functions use STORAGE_GPU_MEMORY_BUFFER, which allows the

test code not to change.



Bug: b:277581596

Test: Encode, image processor, and decode tests pass on Cherry

Change-Id: I11bad5464c860b28a70b3ee44f32a26640304d4c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5237715

Commit-Queue: Nathan Hebert

Reviewed-by: Hirokazu Honda

Reviewed-by: Andres Calderon Jaramillo

entry.title: [Remote Playback] Change Cast overlay button visibility
entry.content:
This CL makes the following changes:

(1) When the cast overlay button is hidden for autoplay muted videos,

the button appear on tap and click only. Previously, the button appears

on pointerover and pointermove, which is distracting on sites using

background videos on desktop.

(2) Hide the cast overlay button explicitly if the conditions for

showing the cast overlay button aren't satisfied. Previously, the

cast overlay button is hidden when the hide media controls timer fired

or when Remote Playback isn't available. As a result, the overlay

cast button appear when it shouldn't.

entry.title: Revert "Add notifyEvent API for fenced frames."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 62f8e1eb2e54597cacc165645e888c6b89229826.



Reason for revert:

virtual/fenced-frame-mparch/external/wpt/fenced-frame/notify-event-invalid.https.html is flaky across multiple platforms, and this CL

is shown within the suspected range.

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20Tests/141362/overview

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Win10%20Tests%20x64/88121/overview



Original change's description:

> Add notifyEvent API for fenced frames.

>

> This API allows DOM events that occur within a fenced frame

> to be observed by the frame's embedder in a privacy-respecting manner.

> When an eligible event type (currently, just click) occurs within

> the embedded document, window.fence.notifyEvent(e) can be called

> with the event object, which will create a censored version of

> the event to be handled by the embedder via addEventListener().

>

> This API is being implemented as part of the "fenced frames with

> local unpartitioned data access" proposal, see explainer here:

> https://github.com/WICG/fenced-frame/blob/master/explainer/fenced_frames_with_local_unpartitioned_data_access.md

>

> Design doc for this CL is here:

> https://docs.google.com/document/d/1EiysMPnARSx2pzI1hSeFlI7k2ETxs5ycZoV2Cy08PEk/edit?usp=sharing

>

> Bug: 1515579

> Change-Id: I7f155e5640e7b798ca33a48c6afdda9c039d45c0

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5166147

> Reviewed-by: Alex Moshchuk

> Commit-Queue: Andrew Verge

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1260541}

entry.title: Fade hub panes when switching between panes.
entry.content:
This mirrors the old tab switcher logic of a sequential 120 ms fade

out followed by a 120 ms fade in that the RecyclerView provided.

However now we switch between two RecyclerViews, and we implement the

fade ourselves.



The basic idea is that we fade out the old pane's root view, and fade

in the new pane's root view. However the panes were previously

responsible for drawing a background color, and fading the background

does not look right.



To solve this we now move the responsibility of drawing background to

the pane host, and the tab list code stops when Hub is enabled.



Bug: 319144954

entry.title: [Mac] Fix Webshare
entry.content:
This CL fixes a crash in a mac pwa when navigator.share is invoked.

SharingServicePicker is dealloc-ed when out of scope and the mojo callback is killed before the callback is invoked crashing the app shim process. The fix is to make it a strong member to RenderWidgetHostNSViewBridge so it does not get cleaned up.



The browser however does not crash but the share picker behavior is flaky and sometimes just keeps on waiting for the callback.



This Cl also updates the position of the share picker to be next the cursor to improve the UX (similar to what Safari does).

entry.title: Enable Widevine CDM rollback on Linux/ChromeOS
entry.content:
Component Update allows for downgrading components to an earlier

version. However, on Linux and ChromeOS, the Widevine CDM needs

to be loaded before the zygote is locked, and thus uses a hint

file to determine which version is supplied by Component Update.

Current checking in cdm_registration uses the larger of the bundled

version or the Component Updated version (if both exist), so if the

downgrade is to a version prior to the current bundled version, the

rollback doesn't work.



To fix this, the hint file created when a new component is downloaded

is updated to keep track of the bundled version at the time it was

downloaded, as Component Update will check the bundled version when

determining if a new version is required. If the bundled version

matches this saved version, then the bundled version is skipped when

checking what should be loaded into the zygote (thus always loading

the Component Updated version).



Bug: 1518051

differ to accommodate for the window minimum size limitations,

still depend on the initial snap ratio of the first window

snapped. We should update snap ratio before committing the snap

event.

entry.title: [omnibox] Remove NOTREACHED() and throw out invalid starter pack ids.
entry.content:
Currently, when there is an unknown starter pack ID, we reach a

NOTREACHED(). This presents a problem when trying to expand the starter

pack since someone running a newer version of chrome (e.g. on Canary)

will have the new starter pack entry loaded in their database. If they

then sync that profile to an older version of Chrome (e.g. stable),

that entry will persist despite the codebase not recognizing it as a

potential ID.



This CL removes the NOTREACHED() since logging an invalid ID is less

catastrophic than causing a user's chrome to crash. It also adds a

check to throw out any invalid starter pack entries that come down

from sync.



Bug: 41494524, 325307771

Change-Id: I44465089e435a56567378896866cda5220230376

For the Protected Audience feature, component auctions in the auction config passed to navigator.runAdAuction() can now specify the 'deprecatedRenderURLReplacements' field to trigger replacements in the winning ad URL. This functions similarly as the navigator.deprecatedReplaceInURN() function, but is included as part of the auction config for component auctions or single level auctions.



Bug: 321925179

entry.title: build: Switch Android from -Oz to -Os
entry.content:
This adds 800 kB to binary size.



In return, we get:

* Fewer build configs for platforms with many users. Chrome/CrOS

builds also use -Os (see internal go/cr-os -- that doc also makes

the point that speedometer is already manually tweaked with

optimizer flags and isn't the best thing to look at when comparing

perf between optimizer flags) and I think on Windows,

/O1 also basically maps to -Os

* One less thing the people working on bounded iterators have to

keep an eye on. (And we can try undoing this in a year to see

if it was an issue.)

* Possibly better performance for some non-hot code (maybe startup)?



We're keeping Fuchsia on -Oz since Fuchsia is extremely sensitive

to binary size and doesn't seem to care too much about performance.

(It configures this in a somewhat hard to find spot instead of

in the gni file that sets optimize_for_size:

build/config/fuchsia/size_optimized_cast_receiver_args.gn)



Bug: 40249335

Binary-Size: Expected 800 kB binary size growth on low-end Android.

Change-Id: I8a1c91e1442e21c4238fab87978e836d9a2d4238

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3586402

entry.title: Annotate existing dangling pointers to re-enable DPD [1/N]
entry.content:
Context:

--------

The DanglingPointerDetector has been disabled today in:

https://crrev.com/c/5288053



The cause was a bug in MiracleObject, causing memory leak for all the

targeted objects: RenderFrameHost, View, BrowserContext, ... This

prevented the DanglingPointerDetector to be enforced. It also caused a

memory regression on M122 beta.



It had to be reverted, but it couldn't because of the dangling pointers

we missed. So, the DanglingPointerDetector had to be disabled too to

allow cherry-picking the revert to beta.



We must enable it as soon as possible: It is easier to block developers

against the CQ than fixing issues after they have been merged. Without

it, developers are missing ~15 new dangling pointers every day.



This patch:

-----------



This patch annotate the dangling pointers we missed while MiracleObject

was enabled.



This patch was partially made by @mikt, and then I added the the others

using the rebased CQ instrumentation:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5040438/24



The goal is to allow a follow-up to enable the

DanglingPointerDetector again.



AX-Relnotes: n/a.

DanglingUntriaged-notes: Re-enabling DPD.

Bug: 325107813, 324994233

Change-Id: I42b566a087bcb0f9a9dd2d4a06d0284af5d22e74

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5297174

Commit-Queue: danakj

Owners-Override: danakj

Commit-Queue: Arthur Sonzogni

Reviewed-by: danakj

entry.title: Replace (and invert) LCPP's dryrun mode default
entry.content:
LCPP‚Äôs dryrun state is flagged off by default ‚Äî i.e., by default LCPP

makes changes to request priorities unless flagged by each experiment.

Each experiment today flags dryrun=on explicitly, when not needed.

This becomes a conflicting signal for another experiment on the same

client that wants to make priority adjustments. Instead if we flip

the flag to not have priority adjustment by default, the experiments

that don‚Äôt need a priority adjustment don‚Äôt have to explicitly

turn it off, thereby minimizing conflicts.



Bug: 1419756

Change-Id: I6d7bbdc20628259f1a2459a6f3c3a9d85bf1aea3

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5280980

Commit-Queue: Alex N. Jose

entry.title: Reland "[AsyncSB] Add PostCommitInterstitial browser tests"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 1f89e4520df8ef8cb5e41b2db9373767fd906fb6.



Currently the test is flaky when BFCache is disabled. This reland

temporarily fixes it by enforcing BFCache to be enabled when the

test runs (note: BFCache is currently enabled by default). The root

cause is that when going back to the original page, Chrome triggers

a new Safe Browsing check and adds the URL to the pending list the

second time, so the URL is not fully removed from the pending list

when OnBlockingPageDone is called. A real fix will be added in a

follow-up CL.



Diff can be found between Patchset1 and Patchset2.



Original change's description:

> [AsyncSB] Add PostCommitInterstitial browser tests

>

> Previously, several subresource browser tests were disabled because of

> kSafeBrowsingSkipSubresources. Some of these tests are in essence

> testing the functionality of post commit interstitial and should not

> be limited to warnings triggered by subresources.

>

> This CL ports the tests that are relevant to post commit interstitial

> under SafeBrowsingBlockingPageAsyncChecksTimingTest. It reveals an

> issue that the security indicator is persisted if the Safe Browsing

> check is completed between ProcessResponse and FinishNavigation

> (see the TODO in SecurityStateGoBackOnPostCommitInterstitial). It

> will be fixed in a follow up CL.

>

> The old tests are removed entirely since we plan to clean up the

> kSafeBrowsingSkipSubresources flag soon.

>

> This CL also removes the "MAYBE" before

> IframeOptInAndReportThreatDetails. We will monitor if this test is still

> flaky on Mac.

>

> Bug: 40941453,40934310

> Change-Id: I64ea7478bf842ccc726244df5814e6906c120295

entry.title: Fix PushMessagingBrowserTest.PushEventEnforcesUserVisibleNotification
entry.content:
This test verifies that the browser shows a default notification after a

site repeatedly fails to show a notification during the push JavaScript

event.



This change fixes a race at the end of the test. If the site shows a

notification while the browser‚Äôs default notification is visible, the

default notification must close. However, closing the default

notification is an async operation. The flakiness occurs because the

expectation that the default notification is closed often fails because

both the site notification and the browser's default notification are

still visible.



The fix uses

NotificationDisplayServiceTester::SetNotificationClosedClosure() to wait

for the default notification to close before verifying that the site's

notification is the only notification visible, which eliminates the race.



Bug: 40405540

Change-Id: I1da259e21791a5de0174c98e405c5db77146e98a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5280500

entry.title: customization: Block modifiers on some mice to allow customization
entry.content:
Some mice send a button that is a combination of modifiers and then a

normal key (ex Ctrl + Shift + Tab). To make these buttons customizable,

we intend to block the modifiers for these devices at an evdev level

when the mouse is being customized. Examples of mice that do this is

the MX Master 3, MX Master 2S, and M720.



In the Peripheral Customization code, we are explicitly allowlisting

devices to opt into this behavior. It will start with a _very_ small set

of devices and slowly grow as we discover additional devices with

similar behavior.



To do this, we send a vector of device ids that should fully block

modifier events. This set of device ids can either all be from the same

peripheral (think a mouse that identifies as both a mouse and keyboard)

or multiple peripherals (think multiple mice with this issue or even

two of the same model).



To be careful to not taint the input stream, any previously held

modifiers are released in both EventConverterEvdevImpl as well as

GestureInterpreterLibevdevCros.



Tested with both real devices and on a physical keyboard myself trying

to break the feature by holding modifiers and toggling this

`block_modifiers_` flag.



Bug: b/241965717

Change-Id: If12556ddafb599a7f07c0f5e7d688b9025d96bcd

entry.title: [remoting host] Add SessionAuthzHostAuthenticator to the negotiating authenticator
entry.content:
This CL adds the SessionAuthzHostAuthenticator to the negotiating

authenticator so that it can be used for authentication.



Note that the design of NegotiatingHostAuthenticator and

Me2MeHostAuthenticatorFactory does not support SessionAuthz->3P auth

fallback, since you basically need to decide which method to use when

creating the authenticator. This makes it impossible to roll out

SessionAuthz on the client side, and would complicate PIN exemption. So

this CL reworks the logic for adding supported methods.



Based on local tests, 3P auth, pairing auth, and PIN auth still works

with the new logic. The host claims support for

`corp_session_authz_spake2_curve25519`, but the second method will be

used since the client doesn't support SessionAuthz yet.



Bug: b/323068262

entry.content:
The retry should never be a solution unless there is a clear race

condition. Since the original bug has been fixed already. We should

avoid random retries.



Meanwhile increasing the timeout to a large value can help reduce the

potential timeout caused by random unrelated load on the host machine.

In practice, the timeout would be sufficient enough to only kill the

process when something is very wrong.

entry.title: [live-preview] Fix GMB issue with Windows
entry.content:
When GpuRasterization is not available or if there is no support for

D3dSharedImage, rendering GMB frames fails.



The video preview is implemented by painting the video frame into a

tile via PaintCanvasVideoRenderer in the browser compositor. When the

incoming video resource is a GpuMemoryBufferHandle it goes to

GpuMemoryBufferHandleHolder which wraps it in a shared image. That

should work fine if the tile is GPU rasterized, since the video frame

texture to tile texture copy happens on the GPU, but it won't work in

case of software raster since rasterization happens in the browser

process and GPU texture data is unavailable. This CL provides a fix

for that by requesting pre-mapped frames and wraps the

SharedMemoryRegion.



Bug: b:319273222

public interface and not needed in this delegate. Additionally, as the

current flat stateless is currently not handling protected playback,

the relevant functions/structs have been removed.

entry.title: Remove //chrome/tools/build/chromeos/
entry.content:
These files are presumed to be old & unused.



When building a new CrOS image, the CrOS release builders use this

script to scrape together the list of files packed into the image:

https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:chromite/scripts/deploy_chrome.py



And that script builds its list of files via:

https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:chromite/lib/chrome_util.py



So nothing in //chrome/tools/build/chromeos/ should be read by that

process.



As for lacros, it currently uses:

https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/infra/archive_config/lacros64-archive-rel.json



So it should be safe to delete these old config files.

entry.title: Measure usage of getCoalescedEvents.
entry.content:
We measure the use of predicted events, but not coalesced events.

The PEWG would be able to use this information to help inform the use

of the API, and could help with possible deprecation of

getCoalescedEvents in insecure contexts.

entry.title: views: fix focus ring invisible issue in LayoutManagerBase
entry.content:
FocusRing was not laid out by LayoutManagerBase because it reports a zero preferred size. This patch marks FocusRing as a "decorative view",

such that:



* it has the View property kIsDecorativeViewKey set to true.

* its visibility is respcted by LayoutManagerBase. i.e. the layout

manager's proposed visibility is disregarded.

* its Layout() is always invoked during layout.



Bug: b/325029896

Change-Id: I02daf708405cb3f9db777293107f8cd516929b0a

entry.title: Remove View::GetClassName overrides
entry.content:
Metadata macros already create a GetClassName function. For classes

that already implement metadata GetClassName is not needed especially

since most of the time the returned classname is the same as the macro

version. Remove these overrides. For classes that do not have

metadata implemented, implement metadata and then remove overrides.



- Nested classes will be prefixed with the outer class name

- Places that used IsClassName to check for the corect object will use

IsViewClass instead



The following classes will have the class name changed in order to

standardize the class names through metadata



ShelfAppButton

original: ash/ShelfAppButton

new: ShelfAppButton



NotificationListView::MessageViewContainer

original: MessageViewContainer

new: NotificationListView::MessageViewContainer



TaskContinuationView::TaskChipsView

original: TaskChipsView

new: TaskContinuationView::TaskChipsView



PowerButtonMenuScreenView::PowerButtonMenuBackgroundView

original: PowerButtonMenuBackgroundView

new: PowerButtonMenuScreenView::PowerButtonMenuBackgroundView



StatusAreaWidgetDelegate

original: ash/StatusAreaWidgetDelegate

new: StatusAreaWidgetDelegate



Bug: 5287851

Change-Id: I674959d00d09a09df297684d70103dbc76ab46a8
